tactics_simplicity.probleme: Losing a match against someone around your playing level

debutant.nom: Developing a large arsenal of possible tactics

exercices_complementaires.nom: Attacking all three spots - wide forehand, wide backhand, middle
exercices_complementaires.description: End the point to the forehand when that side opens up

exercices_complementaires.nom: Looping all deep serves and dropping nearly all short serves short
exercices_complementaires.description: No flipping except as an occasional variation

exercices_complementaires.nom: Following the opponent's elbow around and keeping attacking it
exercices_complementaires.description: Opponent had long arms and was very strong from the corners

exercices_complementaires.nom: Taking shots as quick as possible and taking everything to the wide backhand
exercices_complementaires.description: Take out the opponent's very strong forehand while reducing him to playing his weak backhand

exercices_complementaires.nom: Gaining a willingness to cover much of the table with your strong backhand
exercices_complementaires.description: Go after the forehand relentlessly, never going to the backhand side unless the opponent moves over to play backhand from the forehand side - and then quick-block to the open backhand side

erreurs_a_eviter: Don't fret too much about finding 'perfect' tactics
